newsitem.title: USA: US domestic auto sales up 3.4 pct Nov 21-30 -- CNW.
newsitem.headline: US domestic auto sales up 3.4 pct Nov 21-30 -- CNW.

text.p: U.S. domestic auto sales rose 3.4 percent in the 10-day period November 21-30 compared with the same period a year ago, according to a CNW Marketing/Research report released Wednesday. The figures include leased vehicles.
Domestic car sales slipped to 206,892 from 214,631, CNW said. Domestic truck sales jumped 13 percent, to 179,202 from 158,624, it said.
Import car sales fell 2.6 percent to 59,637, and import truck sales increased 7.7 percent to 14,924, the report said.
CNW said 34.6 percent of the vehicles were leased, up from 31.6 percent in the same period last year.
About 14.1 million vehicles were sold in the United States from January through the third week in November 1996, CNW said.
